metadata.Title: CVE-2022-35977 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description: Redis is an in-memory database that persists on disk. Authenticated users issuing specially crafted `SETRANGE` and `SORT(_RO)` commands can trigger an integer overflow, resulting with Redis attempting to allocate impossible amounts of memory and abort with an out-of-memory (OOM) panic. The problem is fixed in Redis versions 7.0.8, 6.2.9 and 6.0.17. Users are advised to upgrade. There are no known workarounds for this vulnerability.

criterions.comment: redis package in esm-apps/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
